CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mae Thornhill, housewife, 200 Kearns Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 28, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the morals of the community are better than they used to be, worse or about the same? If there is any change, what do you think caused it?" answer reads: "I feel as though they are much better and the reason appears to be because of better jobs and modern inventions."
TitMainTitle: Mae Thornhill wearing two button textured coat, eyeglasses, and light colored head scarf, carrying decorative box with string, young girl on right wearing dark patterned dress, zippered jacket with hood, light colored patterned scarf, and gloves, standing in front of swirled granite wall and Lutheran Church Supply Store sign, Wood Street, Downtown
